Reviews.Title: “It is true - Authentic, Charming, and lots of character”
Reviews.Author: atlbeme
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying those who come and stay at this place and then write a bad review clearly did not read up on it's unique character ahead of time. It pays to do your home work. We knew exactly what to expect and got more than we expected. We found the walk down the "alley" perfect. One minute you are on the main noisey tourist crowded bridge in front of the Antico Doge, and with in a few steps.. complete quiet was you walk through the metal gate to the courtyard in front of the entry door. Yeah the building next door is boarded up and run down, but half of Venice is the same way with or with out boards. The double flight of stairs to the main lobby only add to the intrigue. It's like you're entering someones old venetian house. which you are! it is conviently located to the Rialto bridge. Easy walk from the Ca D'oro boat stop.. We did splurge and take a private water taxi back to the airport. pick up was by the bridge out front 30 minutes to the airport. we spent 4 nights there with two friends. we booked the Junior Suite and the Triple room respectively (we decided for size and not the canal view) The Junior Suite is HUGE. With a view of the construction chute out one side of the window and the Courtyard below on the other side (oh well who stays in the room and looks out the window anyway) The bath room is huge as well. Our room was so big, we had our friends over the share breakfast at the sitting table, we loved the breakfast. Stefano was so accomodating with everything. breakfast was simple enough, Juice, coffee, rolls, jams. We added to it by getting fruit and sliced meats from the market. The room floor was so crooked it was funny. I read some complaints about this, but again it adds to the charm. Beautiful Glass chandeliers in the rooms. My only issue/concern was the bathroom in the triple room. More specifically the bath tub. very small old style. last time I saw one was 20 years ago in an old B&B in Belgium. you sit in a "well" big enough for your legs,and then a higher up "well" for you butt. anyone of any height or girth is not gonna fit! love this place and would recommend it to any one who appreciates a place with Character and not be fussy.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful”
Reviews.Author: philedge
Reviews.Content: OK, we have just got back from a short break here, The good news is that it is well located and the staff polite. The access is not good - down the alleyway and the tiny square not well looked after. The first hall you enter is, I hope, being re constructed. It had a pile of wood and was very dusty and damp from the canal swilling in from the far end of the hall. The reception is two floors up and looked fine, with rooms off the reception area. BUT our room was off the hall 2 floors below. It was large and quite grand, but with chairs that were repaired and with unsuitable springs!!. The room was at canal level and very noisy from pasing water traffic until late at night and from 0600. The traffic is very heavy duty delivery and waste collection boats, with some water taxi and gondola traffic. Our guess is that the main rooms are fine, BUT you must make sure you are not in this one, if you want good sleep. This is a B&B, not an hotel and room services are minimal. The price is good for Venice, but would be 50% over for our beuatiful city of Bath.

Reviews.Title: “Now we can say we have been back five times to Leon Bianco!”
Reviews.Author: bertram31
Reviews.Content: For us, it is like coming home. Just to stand at the windows of room 4 and take it all in is worth the trip. If you want a Holiday Inn or Best Western experience, this is not the place for you. It really is not a hotel like many people expect. The first time you walk the back street and come up the flight of stairs, you start wondering if all those reviewers in Tripadvisor are crazy. But we love every part of it, even the room door I always bang my head on because I'm over six feet tall. This trip we noticed many upgrades and improvements. Also, they have WiFi now. (if it stops working afterhours, re-boot the router). Stefano is the greatest guy. He is very passionate about his property and has always been the most helpful to us. He has also recommended some very good restaurants. This is Venice. It is like no other place. Get away from the tourists traps and restaurants that try to rip you off and experience this most unique place. We will be back, and we look forward to being awakened by the boat traffic and the cry of the gulls circling just outside our room.

Reviews.Title: “What a little gem!”
Reviews.Author: Tilgner
Reviews.Content: We went at the end of March for a weekend to Venice as part of our 'mini-moon'. Stefano, the owner, was incredible helpful prior to our trip, sending very clear and detailed directions from Treviso. Since we arrived very late and the surrounding bars were about to shut, he gave us a little wine bottle on the house, so we could enjoy the wonderful view from the room, vino in hand. They say Turner used to paint here and you can understand why he must have loved this little hotel so much! The location couldn't be more convenient. Next to the Rialto, it is clean and the rooms have their individual, Venetian charm, with Murano glass lights and Burano lace on the table. Breakfast is brought to the room, so you can once again enjoy the wonderful views over the Canal Grande and the Rialto market. You get your own set of keys for the entire hotel, so even if you come home very late there is no worry you might not get in anymore. This also allowed us to spend Sunday without dragging our suitcases with us, but we could leave them in the hotel and pick them up at our own accord. Stefano is so lovely, so kind and helpful we could have not asked for a more charming host. He really tries to meet every wish and accomodate any individual request. We never had such an uncomplicated, welcoming and homely trip. We will definitely come back and also recommend this place to our friends. It is good to know there are still special, nice, little places away from mainstream hotels, and above all affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing View and Room”
Reviews.Author: Jayne S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week for 3 days and it was a perfect location with a lovely big room The hotel itself was a little challenging to find but I think that's the same for most hotels there! The hotel room was lovely and we had bit frenh windows that opened up onto the Grand Canal with a corenr view of the Rialto Bridge and a view accross to the Rialto Market. San Marco square was only a 15 min walk. Lovely owners with a nice continental breakfast served in your room while we sat and looked out at the Grand Canal.

Reviews.Title: “Rude”
Reviews.Author: SnfRomania
Reviews.Content: Ok this place rating is worng on tripadviser, This is more of a hostel I think ( because i never been in one so i wont know ) Not even close to a 3* but with 4 * prices (150 euro per night) The street you walk into to get to the hotel is a creepy ,small and dirty. Once you arrive you ring the door bell and they buzz you in. We a get a room, once in there heating not working ( which is a air conditoner that they use for heating ) The room was on the groundfloor which in next to the exit door where its very very cold ! So , the guy starts trying to make it work in the end he did ! and it will take a while to heat the room ...Ok i said lets go walking around and by then its good! Before he left i checked the safe ...not working key is stuck .... agagine the guy starts thry to fix brings a spray in the end fixs it . When we come back the room was warmer but not to sleep in we showered and stayed in front of the ac to stay warm! I call the guy he comes in and says wow its warm in here ! " what you want it 30c? " No i want it to be comfortable like in my home i told him because im paying for this ! Very rude starts screaming ! I told him to resolve the prob. he said to bring a heater! i said ok but if its we wont stay! He got upset mumbling turned his back and said u leave tomm. ! Very unprofesional, no service ! In the AM he served breakfast ! me with good manners open the door and say "goodmorning" his part nothing ....only on his way out and back turned "goodmoring" Stefano i think the guys name ! We left they next day for a lil more got in Hotel condtions! Sorry never again! This place is worth maybe 30 euros per night! but i wont stay for free in this place!

Reviews.Title: “venice”
Reviews.Author: Anthony L
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here three times, the most recent last November. It is a small, lovely hotel, in a perfect central location. Excellent personal service by the owners. Grand in every sense but the size.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms as charming as the service...”
Reviews.Author: Djhookie
Reviews.Content: As this hotels facade is nothing to write home about, and it's location down a dark, somewhat scary Venetian alley, you could be forgiven for having your reservations about this hotel. But you would be pleasently surprised upon your arrival upstairs, to a quaint and charming b&b, with everything you'd expect for that price, and a little more. I assume you might feel a little hard done by if you didn't select one of the rooms with the grand canal view, but if you had, the many hours spent staring into its vast beauty would soon beckon your mind from the 'rustic' interiors (which admittedly, are not without their charm). The service from the man who owned the place was aggressively charming, and it was a pleasure to see him in the mornings for what we may call an 'adequate' continental breakfast. All in all, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful location in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: Whistle-while-U-walk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with two other couples and had a wonderful time. The hotel is nicely located with easy access to the Water Taxiâ€™s and walking distance to most places. All three rooms were comfortable and spacious and very traditional. The stairs were long particularly with luggage for 3 week, with no elevator and no assistance. Donâ€™t expect pristine rooms when in Venice, a lot of the charm is staying in older buildings â€“ we loved it. Breakfast was delivered to the rooms each morning and was simple, good and completely adequate. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value B&B in a central location”
Reviews.Author: CotswoldsRachel
Reviews.Content: We wanted a comfortable clean room with a bit of Italian history and character, and that is exactly what we got, plus welcoming hosts and a coffee and croissant in the mornings. With a good map and Stefano's directions it wasn't too hard to find, and it made a great base for exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, authentic but basic”
Reviews.Author: MStanleyLondon
Reviews.Content: Whether you like this hotel or not will depend entirely on what you are looking for - sounds like I'm stating the obvious but in this place, there aren't even any telephones in the rooms (at least there wasnt in ours) But if you want a fantastic location, rooms with with marble floors and chandeliers which wouldnt look out of place at the Doges Palace then this is for you. Conversely if you're idea of a good room is a flat screen TV and Sky, a bar, tea and coffee ad lib and a lift to get you there then you will be disappointed! So yes the hotel isn't all that that easy to find - its down a side alley and the street sign had been covered up which didnt help but once you are there and have your bearings it is very central. We opted for a standard room which didnt have a canal view but we were there for 3 days and not intending to be in the room much so that wasn't a problem - 130euro for a double room in Venice is not to be sniffed at. The bed was comfy, the bathroom clean and the shower hot so no complaints there. We both had smart phones which hooked up easily to the free internet provided so that was a major plus. Breakfast.....well, 3 days of coffee and croissants filled with apricot jam got a bit boring but we were in the cheap seats so maybe others had more variety but this would be our only minor gripe. In summary, for us it was great value for money, we liked being in a 15th century building complete with Gondola garage, didnt mind the 3 flights of stairs and had a very pleasant stay modern it isn't but then neither is Venice! .

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend!”
Reviews.Author: LibbyTeal
Reviews.Content: First of all, the view cannot be beat. We requested a view of the Grand Canal, and had a huge corner room with giant windows overlooking the canal with views of the daily farmers market across the way, and the Rialto just around the bend. The room was in good condition, and it was simply dreamy eating breakfast at our table overlooking the canal each morning. The staff was very friendly and helpful, although their availability seemed a little random. As others have said, it was very difficult to find the hotel when we first arrived -- it's really tucked away on a side street -- but once you know where it is, it's no problem at all. It's very well-located, close to the Rialto Bridge and hundreds of wonderful shops and eateries, and a short walk to St. Mark's Square and other major attractions. For the price, it could be a little more glamorous (we paid almost 200 Euro/night), but it's a perfectly lovely hotel, and the view is totally worth it! Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not that Great”
Reviews.Author: donald m
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned after staying in this Hotel for three days. Let me start with the good - Great location near the Rialto Bridge and the owner is very nice and Euro breakfast was fine. Now the bad. SIGNAGE. More than once my wife ran into people in a daze looking for the hotel. The only way I found it was Google earthing it and sending an e-mail for confirmation. How difficult is it to put a sign on the front gate or by the bridge? We had the Suite which overlooked the dirty courtyard, with a construction chute next to the window. The roof was getting re-done and construction commenced at 8:00am with the workers trampling up the stairs, followed by banging, hammering and the roof tiles crashing down the chute. I'm paying good money to stay in a Hotel, not a construction site. On top of that our door a had a large gap on the bottom and the top, which meant I could hear EVERYONE coming and going, PLUS conversations at the front desk quite clearly. If, that's your idea of quaint and full of character - then this is your Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and you can't beat that view”
Reviews.Author: Dutchman_in_Dublin
Reviews.Content: Leon Bianco is a great hotel/B&B. Stefano is a charming host and the rooms are large and beautiful. There's no breakfast room so you're forced to have breakfast in your room. If you have one of the canal view rooms that means having your breakfast while watching Vaporetti, gondolas and other boats pass your window on the Canal grande. Life doesn't get much better. Not everything is perfect; the airconditioning is a noisy unit and the walls are paper-thin so you can hear everything that's happening in the next room. The bathroom is tiny but clean. The location is great; it's as central as you can get in Venice. Vaporetto stops are around the corner, gondolas on the doorstep. Piazza San Marco is a short walk, as is Fondamenta Nuove to catch the vaporetto to Murano. Canareggio is also full of bars and restaurants. We stayed here for four nights on our honeymoon and couldn't have wished for a better place.

Reviews.Title: “Back a second time and still great”
Reviews.Author: Texas_guy_in_30s
Reviews.Content: For one thing, I love the location of this hotel. It's across from the Rialto market and immediately adjacent to the Palazzo di Mosto (the oldest standing palace on the grand canal and home to Count Francesco di Mosto, the famous architect and historian with a travel show on BBC). The room that I stayed in has a view on the Rialto bridge also. Strada Nuova is immediately behind the hotel (land side), and it's easy to get to all the major tourist sites. This is the perfect place to traghetto across to buy wine and fresh foods at the market, then come back for an evening of sitting at the table in front of the window waving back at the people in the gondolas and water taxis. Stefano has made a big improvement over my last stay with powerful air conditioning units in the rooms now. Also, the new free wifi is extraordinarily fast with a strong signal for Italy. The only possible drawback I can think of with this place is that there might be a problem if you are mobility impaired or have luggage heavier than you are comfortable carrying up the old stairs. But, even though I have no trouble carrying heavy bags, Stefano and staff offered to help at every turn. I'll visit here again as soon as I'm back in Italy!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trip_lulu885
Reviews.Content: Great little find. This hotel is small but is definitely large on character. Great location around the corner from the station (come out of the thin street onto a wider strip of cafes and shops, take a right and walk straight, walk over a bridge and on the right if you look up you will see the name take that right and the htel is at the end - 5 mins walk) Hotel is in a great location for exploring Venice. Inside there are only 7 rooms but all unique and beautifully furnished in a quaint Venetian style. The owners are extremely helpful, every morning me and my partner had another set of directions we needed help with, the owner (name I forgot) was always happy to help with a smile on his face. If you want real Venice stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very decent”
Reviews.Author: OGCC
Reviews.Content: The Leon Bianco's location is ideal in terms of being very close to all the attractions. Without getting lost it's probably a 5 minute walk to St Mark's Square albeit the wife & I never did it in 5 mins & never found the same route twice. Good fun getting lost though and exploring the city. It was very hot and Venice can be expensive so were glad a mini super market was close for plenty of cheap bottles of water. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We had a pre e-mail from the hotel with expert directions to the hotel from the airport from buses, water taxi's, to walking through alleyways. The directions were very much needed as the hotel was hidden away and the entrance to the hotel is not clear at all and left a poor first impression. The room was average, air conditioning good but loud, and unfortunately the breakfast was very poor albeit I was too hot to eat anyhow. But you dont go to venice to sit in your room so was more than acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay !!!”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Locanda Leon Bianco for 4 nights in mid-August in Room Number 4. It was my wife and our two daughters. The "locanda" or guest house was great. It was a little hard to find at first because it was in a non-descript alley, but the location is perfect in the Cannaregio district of Venice. The alleyway is right by a smaller canal and had an internet cafe right in front of the alley and about 40 feet from a good restaurant that we ate in twice, Ristorante Al Vagon. Stefano was very helpful. He advised us on our delayed luggage (which eventually was delivered to the locanda) and directed us to a nearby laundromat to wash our clothes (expensive though, it will come out to 15 to 18 euros for a full load to wash and dry). We rentd Room Number 4 and it was awesome. It was suppose to be for 2 people, but we arranged for the 4 of us (my wife and I and our two small kids) to stay there - so there was a queen for us and two singles for our kids. The room was spacious with a new bathroom. The balcony windows open up to a gorgeous view that is worth the extra money. The window panes and frames were new and lockable and the shutters were newly painted. When they are shut, you can't hear much from outside, but with the view, we had them almost always open. The air conditioner waas fine. There is no TV, we didn't mind it, as we enjoyed our family time and the room. The floor boards creeked though. Breakfast was good. The stairs from the outside to the locanda lobby is quite steep though and at night, the lighting is rather dim, but that is just minor for us. All in all, we enjoyed our stay and would recommend this locanda to anybody looking for a place to stay in Venice that is value -oriented, appreciates a small, personable, well-run establishment ina great location.

Reviews.Title: “Leon Bianco, the essence of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Martin S
Reviews.Content: I have never posted a comment before but this place deserves a little effort. My wife and I had both been to Venice before but wanted to experience the real Venice not just St. Marks and Rialto as so many tourists do. So we decided to spend 5 nights at the Leon Bianco in August 2011 and it was just amazing. We had room #4 overlooking the Grand Canal, rooms 2, 3 & 4 are the ones with a view and worth the extra, at Euro 130 to 150 a night for the room and continental breakfast. The large room was typically Venetian (which was why we chose Leon Bianco) however the room has a modern, spotlessly clean, bathroom, air-conditioning and double glazed top to bottom windows. Stefano was friendly and very helpful and delivered our breakfast to our room on time every day with a smile. After welcoming you Stefano gives you a set of keys to the place and leaves you to it, which was great, itâ€™s like having your own holiday home in Venice. A word of warning, if youâ€™ve eaten too many Big Macâ€™s in your lifetime and canâ€™t climb stairs this is not the hotel for you, try the Marriott, Iâ€™m sure they have elevators. Some travel trips: If youâ€™re flying in to Venice try a shared water taxi from the airport. The taxi will drop you at St. Apostili which is less than 40 meters from the front door of the Leon Bianco. It really is worthwhile and it takes the hassle out of traveling, we can highly recommend the service. www.viator.com We found a really nice restaurant in the back streets of Venice just 5 minutes walk from the hotel away from the tourist hot spots, good value, great food and friendly service. Trattoria Storica, Cannargio 4858, Ponte dei Gesuiti. Tel: [--] If you are staying in Venice for a few days organize yourself a vaporetto (waterbus) ticket over the internet itâ€™s the cheapest way to get to places like Lido, Murano, Burano and anywhere else the vaporettos go. You can redeem your ticket from the machine at the Rialto stop. Without the ticket each ride on the vaporetto will cost Euro 6.50 www.veniceconnected.com

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience that captured the essence of Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Ruth6809
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in Mid July 2011 and will definitely be back. This isn't a Hilton or Marriott, but that's not what we wanted. Breakfast in the room was simple and good quality. The bed was comfortable...The room, though, was exquisite and for the first time in our lives we actually wanted to spend time in the hotel...sipping a wonderful local wine and looking straight along the Grand Canal from the Rialto past Ca' D'oro. Our hosts were gracious, helpful and unobtrusive. The location is hard to beat, just 4 mins walk from Rialto bridge and on the grand canal. We travelled from the airport via Ali Laguna to Rialto. If you have a good map or sense of adventure, it's quicker to take Alilaguna to Fondamenta Nove and walk from there. It all formed part of a most wonderful 4 days and a true highlight of all the travelling we have done over many years.

Reviews.Title: “so far the winner on our round the world trip”
Reviews.Author: zeezonvacay
Reviews.Content: As a couple and our first time in Venice this place was magical - right on the canal with amazingly well sized rooms this really made our time in Venice just that much better. Explicit instructions for navigating to the hotel were emailed personally prior to arrival date which were a godsend with Venice being the maze that it is, the room as a miniature palace and a pleasure to return to each day. Sitting in our window sill watching the gondoliers pass underneath really set the mood and we had no real complaints. Sometimes staff weren't around but they informed us of this fact upon arrival and when they were English wasn't easily used to communicate but we can't wait to return for all future visits to this charming home away from home in Venezia

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is definately what you expect for Venice”
Reviews.Author: Rhettal
Reviews.Content: What a quisessentially Venetian Hotel! While slightly difficult to find, with an underwhelming entry up dark, damp and steep stairs, it provided us with such a great experience of our time in Venice. The owners are lovely - very friendly, kind and helpful. We were provided with breakfast which was not expected which was lovely. We were very fortunate to have a room over looking the Grand Canal which was mesmorising to watch. In the afternoons, we would buy some drinks and snacks and take them back to our room - open up the doors and watch the boats go by. Was so relaxing after a busy day of sightseeing before heading out for dinner. The hotel is central - close to shops, water taxi/boat stops, gondola rides, restaurants and Rialto Bridge. Our price was good. Our room was so full of character - it is old style and decorated to suit with what I would describe as timber provincial furntiture. The walls slope, the floors slope, the door slope, but it was so in fitting with the building, with Venice and with our expectations that it became part of the fun. The room was really large - we certainly had room to spread and were really comfortable there - as I said we had drinks near the window each night. It wasn't by any means modern or new, but we didnt want or expect that for Venice. I would describe this hotel as more of a B and B. We also had access to free wireless internet. There was no TV. We would definately recommend this to other visitors to Venice. We had no issues, complaints or concerns at all - we were very happy, apart from the initial difficulty of finding it and again the owners were really lovely and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Venetian experience with Grand Canal view”
Reviews.Author: PMDLeeds
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights for a self-indulgent ending to an epic journey from UK to Bulgaria for nephew's wedding without flying (arriving on 2-night ferry-cruise up the Adriatic, highly recommended). It was wonderful. Room 2 ("double with Grand Canal view"), couldn't be faulted (OK, one tiny niggle that it would be nice to have glasses rather than plastic cups for a drink on getting back to the room). Fridge a bonus, to chill our water bottles. Who needs a TV? Venice-connected wifi, for which I'd bought a 3-day pass, only available while sitting on the windowsill/balcony, but I was happy to sit there for hours to enjoy the view anyway. The alley and courtyard for access are full of character, the downstairs hallway smells of canal, the stairs are very atmospheric, and the room clean, well-furnished, high quality bathroom, and that amazing view. (With double glazing which kept noise out). The owner was very obliging about letting us leave our luggage till evening - gave us keys for front doors so we could retrieve them. He'd have helped us get our bags upstairs on arrival if we'd rung the bell. No complaints at all. It was expensive, but then Venice is expensive. Relative to other places we looked at online it seemed to be good value for the wonderful experience it was.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location on Grand Canal with views to Rialto Bridge.”
Reviews.Author: NickJackie
Reviews.Content: This small, quiet privately run hotel is in an excellent location on the Grand Canal. Our lovely room had wooden floors, ceiling painting, chandelier and period furniture. It was also airconditioned with a fridge and wi-fi. An easy 5 minute walk to Rialto Bridge or 10 minutes to St Marks Square. Well located for water bus stop and numerous shops, restaurants and bars. Staff are very friendly, they went out of their way to provide a dairy free breakfast for my wife. Note that the continental breakfast is served in your room, there is no separate dining room. If you can upgrade to a room overlooking the Grand Canal you will not be disappointed. An excellent opportunity to sit and watch Venice pass below your window!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful, historical, great location”
Reviews.Author: BnRtraveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel Leon Bianco is a slice of old Venice - tucked away in a wonderful neighborhood close ti the Rialto Bridge - it offers wonderful, old-world accommodations in an authentic Venetian neighborhood. It is a floor in one of the oldest Grand Canal homes, dating back to the 12th century. This is not a luxury hotel - but rather a wonderful space in a very old building, with wonderful worn marble steps leading up to it off a small courtyard. The room was comfortable, the bathroom newly remodeled and modern, but well done and suited to the hotel. The receptionist, for lack of a better term, Marina, was welcoming and helpful and lovely to talk too. The owner brought us fresh croissants, juice, cheeses and hot coffee and milk to our room every morning. We literally had the place to ourselves. Close by was the best coffee and sweets shop we found in Italy, and there is an internet cafe right before you enter the courtyard. Wonderful, we will stay there again the next time we are lucky enough to visit this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID”
Reviews.Author: MrDeegan
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many many hotels over the last ten years or so and I can honestly say that this was of the worst. When we arrived in Venice it was raining heavily and all we wanted to do was get to our hotel and relax for a while. It took a while to find it as the hotel is tucked away between buildings but when we eventually found it we were underwhelmed by the grim stairway and lobby. The room was no better. The floor was on a steep slope, the furniture was shoddy, the place looked like it was about to fall apart. They had told us the hotel had WiFi but the only way to get a signal was to stand in the lobby and even that didn't always work. The room didn't have a television. We were informed that there was a "problem" with the kitchen so if we wanted breakfast we had to go to a restaurant down the street between 8:30 and 9:30. The shower was leaking which meant there was no pressure from the nozzle. The only positive things I can say is that it was quite clean and the location was good. This hotel cost us 150 euro a night and it was definitely not good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantstic room and view!”
Reviews.Author: sallyls
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend Locando Leon Bianco if you are looking for a small, romantic, historic hotel on the Grand Canal, near the Vaparetto stop and great shopping and sightseeing! It was near great shopping without being in the middle of the marketplace. We stayed there April 29, 2011, the day before we left for a cruise. Stefano was terrific, with his internet communications and directions in making arrangements prior to our stay, and in taking care of our needs. This is a small 8 room historic hotel, more of a bed and breakfast as it does not have a restaurant. There is no lift, but Stefano carried our luggage up the stairs to the lobby with ease! The hotel is a short walk from the Ca dâ€™Oro vaporetto stop, and there is only one small bridge to cross. It is in a very nice shopping district and not far to the Rialto Bridge and shopping areas there, and probably 10-15 minutes pleasant walk to Piazza San Marco. I had requested a Canal view room as this was a special trip for my husband and I. Stefano made sure we had a wonderful room. Our room was very large, decorated with what appeared to be antique Italian furniture, high ceilings, a lovely Italian glass chandelier and beautiful decorative carpet, with a small table and chairs in a large area overlooking the canal, and a very nice modern bath with tub/shower ensuite. The room had two large windows, with false iron balconies and wooden shutters overlooking the Grand Canal across from the Mercado Rialto and near the gondola crossing. I could see part of the Rialto Bridge from my window. It was fascinating to me to watch â€œMain Streetâ€� Venice as the various boats and water taxis and gondolas passed by. There is an air conditioner in the room but we did not need it. The bed was adequately firm without being hard. Stefano served us a delightful continental breakfast in our room the following morning. There is some noise from the Canal; my husband and I enjoyed this, since we wanted to experience the activity on the canal and watch the coming and going of all the boats and people, but if you want a quiet room you might want to look for a room off the Grand Canal. The market deliveries start around 7:00 along with the church bells, and though it is not loud you can hear the bustling of Venice beneath your window as the city winds down at night and wakens in the morning. Stefano provided us with a map and great directions, though we found Venice is not so hard to navigate and quite beautiful to explore on foot. I highly recommend the charming historic Hotel Locando Leon Bianco and Stefano for a wonderful stay in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “So glad we booked the Leon Bianco -- great for thinking tourists”
Reviews.Author: michaeln33
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Leon Bianco for a 4-night romantic getaway with my wife just before Easter 2011. This was our first holiday without our son in three years! Needless to say, we so needed to get everything right. And we did. After looking at various options, including 4-5 star hotels in Mestre, we decided it had to be Venice. We read through most reviews in tripadvisor.com and caught a glimpse of the Leon Bianco in episode 1 of Kevin McCloud's Grand Tour series (http://www.youtube.com/show/kevinmccloud%27sgrandtour?s=1). I cannot tell you how happy I was our instincts were right. You see, most reviews at the time of the booking ranged from good to excellent, but there were a few abysmal ones. Now, the bad reviews were complaining about the exact things the good reviews were raving about. Something didn't feel right. So, here's our view, fresh from the holiday: Stefano, the guy who runs the locanda, is very friendly, helpful and punctual. The rooms are cleaned daily to an exceptional standard, and we are very fussy with such things. The location is fantastic, Ca' d' oro and the Rialto are a 2.5 min walk (I timed this), San Marco is a mere 15 minutes. We got breakfast in bed on the dot each day, as promised. Our room (Room 6, with windows on a side canal) was good, although probably not the best one in the hotel, judging from glimpses of other ones. Because of the way the tourist path swerves away from its location and because the rooms are quite high up in the building, our room was also pretty quiet, considering how central the location is. The only sound we could hear was the occasional gondola or speedboat going past at night. Mind you, having the right expectations goes a long way: we had done our research and this made a huge difference. Venice is SO expensive, so Leon Bianco is actually good value. Buildings in Venice are old. We had a lovely marble floor and wooden venetian styled furniture in the room. There is a definite 'old world' feel to the hotel (and Venice, in general) which adds to its charm. The bathroom was very clean and modern. At the same time, I should probably mention: there are three flights of stairs to climb until you get to the hotel. Venice, in general, is not such an easy place with a buggy (in case you're bringing one). The wifi signal was very poor in our room. When we first arrived, we spent about 10 unnecessary minutes walking in circles trying to find the entrance to the hotel (hint to guests: push past the often closed black metal door, the entrance is to your right -- hint to Stefano: a discreet wooden 'Leon Bianco' sign perpendicular to the wall wouldn't hurt, either). And, apart from breakfast, there was no room service during the rest of the day. But so what? If you cannot tell the difference between an old marble floor which has been spotlessly cleaned and a dirty floor, then this hotel is not for you. You may also want to consider choosing a different destination, altogether. Michael & Maria (London)

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NigelJane
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd stay in Venice and this hotel was perfect. Ideal location with delightful staff. Breakfast is served in the room but this is very nice. The rooms are very clean and spacious. The location is perfect as it is so close to the Rialto bridge, very easy to find your way back late at night. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wishes to visit Venice and we will definately be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal family / romantic hotel in Venice with the most helpful staff ever”
Reviews.Author: Heart_Angel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our two young children (aged 6 months and 2 years). The room we had was huge by Venice standards. It had a huge double bed, two single beds and a baby cot and there was still lots of room for us to move around. The bathroom was also massive. The hotel is very central to everything. The highlight of the stay was the staff. They really couldn't be more helpful. In fact Stefano helped us carry our extremely heavy suitcases to the water taxi stop and stayed with us until our taxi arrived. We really cannot speak more highly of this cosy hotel and would stay there again without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - what more can i say!”
Reviews.Author: seanws78
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our honeymoon and it made our stay in Venice perfect. I am not sure how people had problems finding this place before, the instructions on the website give clear directions and we had no issue finding it. We had room number 4 which was a large light spacious room with ensuite and views of the Grand Canal and Rialto bridge. Breakfast is a very welcome treat wth your typical european continental breakfast, including coffee, orange juice, croissants, bread rolls and a toast equivalent. The staff were all very helpful and friendly and I would definitely stay here again. The views from room number 4 alone were worth the reasonable nightly rate. Everything else here was a bonus, and what a bonus it was! I am already planning our return to Venice next year for our anniversary and this will be the hotel we stay in.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful room, location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Kristina000
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel; our room was spacious, clean, delightfully furnished (including a fridge and large comfortable bed) and with two windows with balconies overlooking the grand canal and across to the Rialto market. So we could sit at breakfast and watch all the comings and goings; gondolas, water buses private boats and workmen's boats, or sit at night and watch the lights and listen to the water. The staff speak very good English and are friendly helpful and knowledgeable - particularly the proprietor. Other good things are - wireless internet access (not mentioned on website), masses of tea for breakfast, good selection of books for guests to borrow and good nearby family run restaurant Trattorio da Rino.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: rpatcharin
Reviews.Content: Very good location, the staff were great and we really enjoyed our stay. Very quiet considering how near it is to the tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “Hypnotic Grand Canal views with breakfast served in your room - what more could you ask for in Venice?”
Reviews.Author: Delverie
Reviews.Content: This tiny, friendly, hidden, 2nd floor Locanda is in a handy location for the main sights. Found next to the sadly neglected da Mosto Palace, it has a faded 15th Century ambience, no frills, but with good wi-fi access. It suits the well-seasoned traveller. Our second time in a canal-view room here and we'd happily return. Elaine and Andy, Surrey. UK.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Venice - very memorable”
Reviews.Author: CW0001
Reviews.Content: First trip to Venice (Oct. 2010) - very memorable and this hotel helped make it that way. It was located in the center of Venice - within walking distance to a lot. Our room had a spectacular view of the Grand Canal, including the Rialto Bridge. It was pricey but the location/view were wonderful. The service was great - they are so kind. The in-room breakfast isn't anything spectacular but was a great way to start the day - pastry and coffee oerlooking the Canal. It is an old building and you can hear other guests in the adjacent rooms, but they are nicely decorated - each room has it's own unique theme.

Reviews.Title: “They aim to please!”
Reviews.Author: Niquaa
Reviews.Content: We had an extremely pleasant stay here for three nights in September of this year. I selected the hotel based on reviews here and was not disappointed! Our first positive impression started prior to arrival when we had a change of plans which required a change in the reservation - TWICE! The hotel was so accommodating and kind about our changes - as the one responsible for organizing the trip I really appreciated their attitude toward this. We arrived in Venice on a rainy day and got a bit lost finding the hotel - it is tucked away a little and with the rain we weren't navigating at our best! Despite our late arrival we were warmly welcomed and received a five minute orientation to Venice that provided us first-timers with all the basic information we needed to find our way around for the entire trip! The room was spacious and clean - what more can you ask for? We loved having breakfast brought to us in our room too - a nice change from the usual breakfast room. We appreciated the free wi-fi and having a hair dryer provided - nice little touches that we weren't expecting. We were really happy with the location too - we were able to easily get wherever we wanted by foot or boat and it was nice to be a bit off the beaten path. I'd highly recommend Locanda Leon Bianco for your stay in Venice - they gave us a great start to our Italian vacation and we'll definitely return next time we visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: NswWombat
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our week long stay at Locanda Leon Bianco. We had a room with a spectactular view of the Grand Canal, Rialto markets, sunsets and storms. We could walk to anywhere from here, and all the Vaporettos stop at Rialto or Ca d'Oro. The room was comfortable with everything we needed. Stefano could help us with some of our information requests or direct us to where we could get information. We appreciated the comments on Trip Advisor about how to find it and had no trouble. It was a great start to a wonderful holiday in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Charm and Location in Venice at a great price”
Reviews.Author: July1956
Reviews.Content: Just off the hustle and bustle, Locanda Leon Bianco lies tucked in a private 13 century courtyard up an ancient stone staircase that drips with Venetian atmosphere. Small with only 10 rooms Leon Bianco has caring personal attention from the staff and is as close to living in Venice as one could be. Rooms feature authentic Terrazzo floors identical to those in the Ducal Palace and wonderful Murano glass chandeliers. The Locanda is not luxurious but it is cost effective, peaceful, clean and charming. We stayed with a group of 5 friends and felt comfortable leaving our doors open to visit between rooms in the evenings. Breakfast is juice, warm breads and hot coffee delivered to your door at the time of your choosing...a delightful start to your day in Venice. Located off the Grand Canal some rooms have views and lovely murals.

Reviews.Title: “You pay for the view - and if that's what you want, it'll suit.”
Reviews.Author: lucyantal
Reviews.Content: Guest house rather than hotel - a foyer with rooms. Pleasant staff who were helpful and friendly. Quirky, restored old rooms - we had two interconnecting ones at the front with lovely views of the Rialto & Grand Canal. Tried very hard to keep shutters closed to keep room cool during heat of day but foiled every time by cleaner who flung them open so it was a bit like being in a sauna despite best attempts of air conditioning units. Room kept nice and clean but despite the lovely pastries mentioned in previous reviews, breakfast could be better - coffee was really bad. Much better to go out and grab one at the market opposite. All in all, you ARE paying for the amazing views so can't quibble too much. Have stayed at lots of venetian hotels before so it was nice to try this one but I'm not sure I'd pay so much to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Most amazing room with views of the Grand Canal and a side canal”
Reviews.Author: wrenmary
Reviews.Content: It was our second visit and this time we had a bigger room with two windows looking over the Grand Canal and a third overlooking the side canal. It was even better than we remembered and it was just glorious eating breakfast looking out at the world go by on the Grand Canal. We would love to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “This place is filthy - complete bait and switch”
Reviews.Author: Deslong086
Reviews.Content: My wife booked this hotel based on the web site photos. Upon arrival she found a hotel nothing like what she was led to expect. It was dirty and awful. Upon realizing that she did not intend to check in, the desk clerk called the owner who immediately came over and began harassing my wife and threatening her with the police - as though it was suddenly illegal to not check in to a hotel!! Unfortunately for him, my wife speaks Italian and booked elsewhere but not before the owner screamed at her enough to frightened our 8 and 9 year old. There are many wonderful hotels in Venice. They do not include the Leon Bianco - avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible in every way!”
Reviews.Author: deslong
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with my son and daughter to Venice and was planning to meet a friend in Venice for a few days. We booked the Locanda Leon Bianco online because of its location and the lovely pictures of the rooms. After finally figuring out where it was (you have to go down several small alleyways until you wind up in a urine smelling courtyard. There was just a small sign on the list of doorbells saying "Locanda Leon Bianco." It wasn't even a real hotel! When we rang the doorbell the door opened to a dirty, unkempt foyer with a huge flight of stairs...and no elevator! We had to lug our enormous suitcases up only to discover the rest of the place was even more of a dump! The lady checking us in didn't want to let us see our room before she checked us in (and got my credit card), but I insisted. When I saw our room it was horrible--nothing like the pictures online!! By this point, my children were downright scared. My son briefly sat on the bed and it made a awful creaking sound and he said he felt the springs. I don't know how anyone could sleep on it. It was dark, dingy and scary. When I saw this I felt justified that we booked this room under false pretenses (since it was nowhere near the quality shown in the pictures), so I said we would not be staying there. This is when it got really interesting. She went absolutely ballistic (this has obviously happened before) and went to get the owner. He started shouting--really loudly shouting!-- saying he was going to call the police and that we were not allowed to leave. He demanded that we pay him right then and there, even if we didn't stay. By this point my children were terrified and I wasn't completely sure I would make it back down the stairs with my huge suitcase without him pushing me down. It was that bad. I immediately called my husband and he booked us another room and stopped payment on our card for the Leon Bianco. We just found out that we have to pay because we had reserved it in advance. Even so, it was worth it to me NOT to have to stay there, and if I can prevent anyone else from having such a horrible experience, then it'll be worth it! I'll be curious to see if the hotel people try to block this response (I think they've tried to do this to others) based on the fact that we never actually slept there, but I would argue that we are indeed a paying customer with direct personal experience, so my review is valid!

Reviews.Title: “Great views, plain but practical.”
Reviews.Author: robbiemoonie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Leon Bianco in August. A little tricky to find but if you ask at the restaurant next to the bridge where you think you are lost- they'll diffidently point you down the dingy alley, past the crumbling building ruins and into a tiny courtyard. the staff are courteous and friendly, breakfast is average but served to your door at a time of your choosing - anyway, it's all too easy to jump on the traghetto 50m away and scoot across the river to the famed Rialto markets for fresh produce. We had room 2 which had a glorious view of the river ( surprisingly as we'd asked for the fabled room 4 so had resigned ourselves to no view at all ) but only in one direction - that of the sunset! Rooms are large, bathroom has a bidet, air con works fine, a little noise from the river that can't be heard with shutters closed - no frills, excellent price, great position.

Reviews.Title: “Canal atmosphere - super location”
Reviews.Author: travelviking
Reviews.Content: Located 5 min. away from the Rialto bridge. No lift, so you have to carry the luggage up a lot of stairs. Only 7 rooms. Our room had a view of a side canal and you can hear the gondollas sailing by all the time if you keep the window open. The room was spacious with modern bathroom. Fridge+tv+ac. Breakfast served in room. Great location. Quiet even though it is located close to the sights. Great staff. Good value at 110 euro pr night for two adults and a 10 year old

Reviews.Title: “the town that filled my heart in”
Reviews.Author: Iuliana_Hreniuc
Reviews.Content: Great room with old style furniture; wonderful mornings from the window view on the small streets; tasty breakfast and very nice staff. It makes you want to come back. I had 1044 photos in 4 days. I wanted to take photos from every corner of Venice to have pieces of a great puzzle.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here and you'll want to return!”
Reviews.Author: 4888Rob
Reviews.Content: Excellent value and an excellent location. Room was comfortable, oldfashioned but in a good way with excellent modern bathroom. Breakfast was promptly and pleasantly served in our room - lovely fresh croissants. Our room overlooked a side canal - when we return we will have a room overlooking the Canal Grande. Stefano on the desk very helpful and attentive. Good family restaurant just 50 metres away by the bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico......a true Venetian experience”
Reviews.Author: gillian1andlaurie2
Reviews.Content: Like previous reviewers I had watched Kevin McCloud on his "Grand Tour of Europe" check into this Locanda, where he fortunately mentioned the name. We were three couples so I booked 3 rooms in advance including the "Turner' room, which I was keen to stay in myself being a McCloud fan. Well we weren't disappointed in the room at all, all that previous reviewers have said is true, the amazing nearness of the Grand Canal is breathtaking. We loved all the hustle and bustle and actually loved seeing the water ambulance fly down the canal narrowly missing the gondolas, amazing. Stefano & Marina couldn't be more helpful and charming. If you ARE a group of three couples it is worth saying that the Turner room (#4) is by far the larger of the three Grand Canal rooms, room # 3 is quite a bit smaller and #2 is smaller again. These three rooms have interconnecting doors and we all used the bigger room to have breakfast and cocktails there. I would still highly recommend these three rooms for three couples but work out beforehand who is taking what and pay accordingly so nobody will be disappointed. Anyone of these three rooms would be a delight on its own. I will definitely return to this lovely character filled Venetian delight.

Reviews.Title: “Venice's Best Kept Secret”
Reviews.Author: abeurohi
Reviews.Content: Veniceâ€™s best kept secret. If you are looking for a hotel with sweeping Grand Canal views, a superb central location, and the best value for your euro, Locanda Leon Bianco, is highly recommended. The kind, courteous, and accommodating Stefano is the perfect host. Marina who is upbeat and energetic, will greet you with a smile upon check in. She is a wealth of information and will provide you with a Venice map, tips & suggestions, to help make your stay enjoyable. We stayed at Room #3 with unobstructed Grand Canal views. Our room was spacious, sunny and comfortable. The dÃ©cor had an elegant charming old world Venice feel. The high ceiling and smooth hardwood floor, a/c and mini-fridge, helped keep the temperatures cool. Continental breakfast is served in your room. The fresh out of the oven marmalade filled croissants were so good we looked for them at a bakery, and found them! While we enjoyed breakfast, we watched across the Grand Canal, the produce/fish vendors set up at the Mercato Rialto. The hotel is in a convenient everything-at-your-finger-tips-neighborhood. Restaurants, shops, atms. A supermarket, gelateria, pizzeria, internet cafÃ©. The hotel offers free internet for those who have a laptop. No in room television but who needs it when you have the nautical activity of the Grand Canal just outside your window to keep you entertained. On our last night, we decided to order take out from a nearby pizzeria, stay in our room, and watch the sunset over the Grand Canal. Iconic, classic, and timeless. This is our second stay at Locanda Leon Bianco here and for what the hotel has to offer, the rooms rates are competitive. Email Stefano for possible specials.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful room with beautiful view of the canal”
Reviews.Author: gabriellaotty
Reviews.Content: Locanda Leon Bianco is a charming little hotel in the heart of venice, only a 15 minute walk from Piazza San Marco. It has a few small but clean rooms and a beautiful, much larger, incredibly ligth room with three windows and a lovely, painting-like view of the Canal. We saw the bedroom on the website and liked its simple elegance and warmth. When we arrived to the hotel we were relieved to find that the room was exactly as it appeared on the website, both in terms of decor and size. It is truly the kind of room where one is happy to return to for a rest between sightseeing trips; we enjoyed burning, pink-red shafts of sunlight as late as 6pm (in March!) We were received by Signor Stefano, who was most welcoming and helpful. At the end of our trip, when we realised we had left a pair of shoes behind, Signor Stefano arranged for a delivery and was so generous as to pay for it. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Leon Bianco - the beauty and cleanliness of the room, the quiet, the comfort of the bed, the nice breakfast (served in the room) and friendly service, the excellent location in the Rialto Quarter make Leon Bianco the ideal place to stay. I could not think of a place offering better value for money in Venice, and I warmly recommend it to anyone who is planning a restful, romantic stay in this most beautiful city. T & G Otty, UK

Reviews.Title: “It was like going back in time; we had a room with a beautiful view in an excellent location and at a reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: bidyou
Reviews.Content: The entrance to Leon Bianco is very atmospheric. After coming in the door, you pass the old gondola entrance on the side canal before climbing a very large and old stone staircase. The outside entrance is in a very quiet courtyard just beside a very busy bridge so it is a surprise to find how quiet it is inside. We gasped with surprise on seeing our view of the Grand Canal, with the lovely sunlight pouring in through the tall windows. It was a pleasure to eat our breakfast there while watching all the boat traffic pass. The staff, Stefano and Marina, are both very friendly and helpful. They gave us excellent advice when we asked for it, also a map, an extra pillow and an adaptor plug to use while we stayed. The location is perfect because the Rialto Bridge is near, and also the traghetto (gondola ferry) for crossing the canal between Santa Sofia and the Rialto Market is even nearer and an excellent way to get across. We can only say good about Leon Bianco and will recommend it to all our friends, and we are already looking forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value, excellent location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: webberanne
Reviews.Content: Huge room, spotlessly clean and lovely & quiet. Excellent value for money. More of a B&B than "hotel" but with hotel quality rooms. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, nice accomodations, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: maizer
Reviews.Content: Located on the Grand Canal, but just off the beaten track. Follow your street directions through a small alley and past an iron gate to find the door. Just around the corner from a major tourist boulevard, a 5 minute walk to the Rialto and 15-20 to San Marco. The proprietor, Stefano, speaks good English and was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, familiar, lovely small hotel. Feeling of the 16th. century!”
Reviews.Author: Feco55
Reviews.Content: We spent four wonderful days during the Venice carnival. We were lucky to get this excellent "locanda" in Venice. We lived four days in the 16th century, of course with internet in our room. The place is completely venetian. If you want a high grade "HOTEL" with big glass entrance, big lounge (ang expensive fare) this hotel is not what you eypect. But! If you want to feel and enjoy VENICE, come here. Look around from the windows of hotel and you will see, imagine the history. We will come back. Soon. F. Laszlo from Budapest, Hungary

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel, helpful and friendly staff, overlooking the Grand Canal, not far from Rialto Bridge.”
Reviews.Author: Brianaco
Reviews.Content: We stayed there four nights, and had a fabulous time in this charming hotel. Hard to find, partly because the city is so disarming and bewildering on arrival, partly because it the entrance is hidden in a small old courtyard, with barely a sign to advertise itself. Use the number on the address (5629) as a guide. The entrance is off-putting, but the charm and friendliness of the welcome soon make you feel perfectly at home. The location is superb; three minutes from the Rialto markets, and St Mark's square is probably a twenty minutes walking or by waterbus. The owner offered us a room with a canal view at no extra price for the second two nights, simply because it was vacant. Sleep was peppered with the occasional water ambulance passing beneath us, - all part of the Venice experience! - but the views were breath-taking. What terrific fortune brought us to this beautiful little hotel!

Reviews.Title: “We look forward to going back...”
Reviews.Author: krisandkelly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Leon Bianco Hotel for 2 nights at the start of February 2010. We are a married couple in our mid-thirties and spotted the hotel on the Channel 4 TV show Kevin McLoud's Grand Tour. Mr McLoud stayed in the Turner room at the hotel, the room where the painter JMW Turner stayed during his Grand Tour, we visited the hotel website and booked up the Turner room (room #4). Immediately the email communication from hotel owner Stefano was friendly and useful â€“ sending information on how to find the hotel, tips and answering special requests within 24 hours. Arriving at the airport we took the ACTV bus into Venice and caught the water-bus to the stop nearest the hotel. The 31EURO 72 hour ACTV pass is a must and great value getting around. Once we arrived at the bus-stop we followed Stefano's simple instructions and found the Hotel, a 5-6 minute walk. The travellers on here who had problems finding the hotel clearly cannot read a map. The stairs up to the hotel (it only has 7 rooms) were a real insight into Venetian architecture and the structure of their buildings, after a couple of flights they opened into a beautiful reception with a smiling Stefano waiting to greet us. Check-in was easy and we were given front door keys, room keys and shown our room which was wonderful. Bright and large with 2 large windows opening out onto the Grand Canal, another large window opening onto another canal that runs along the side of the hotel. The room was clean, included a fridge, hair dryer and all your basic necessities. There was no TV, including one there would be a travesty, sitting in front on your window with a nice glass of Cabernet Franco watching the world go by is entertainment enough and I can see why Turner wanted to sketch it. The bathroom was clean and well stocked, beds comfy, lots of storage space and a safe to use. It's basic but it is perfect. My only slight issue was that the room was a little cold but the weather was freezing outside so we just wore another layer. Stefano met all of our requests: extra pillows, wine glasses and a place to store our bags after checkout on the last day. He brings you breakfast in the morning with a polite tap on your door. The breakfast included bread rolls, croissants, spreads, coffee and juice â€“ all you need considering that as soon as you start walking around Venice you tend to be eating all day â€“ it's a place of little and often and suited us perfectly. The room was quiet at night and we enjoyed the bustle during the evening, we were out all day, it never disturbed us, in fact it was quite the pleasure. The hotel is perfectly situated for the bus stop, local shops and restaurants, a beautiful church and all over the man sites. The market is a Gondola ride across the Grand Canal (1 EURO and 8 minutes door to door) and the Rialto bridge is a 5 minute walk. All-in-all the hotel felt like home and you really couldn't ask for much more than that. The people are friendly in the district and the prices aren't as expensive as they are as you get close to Piazza San Marco. We were very sad to leave and we would not hesitate to go back and stay with Stefano at the Hotel Leon Bianco again. In fact we very much look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and easy going”
Reviews.Author: CarolineBrowning
Reviews.Content: We were surprised at how easy it was to find the place - once you cross the bridge you turn right and hotel (no 5629) is situated in a small coirtyard behind a small gate We fully appreciated the staff representative who waited for us to arrive late in the night. Hotel facilities are adequate, breakfast service very satisfactory and hotel attitude feels very much like home. It is suggested better sign posting is available before client gets to Ponte Santi Apostoli!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice service, up three flights of stairs”
Reviews.Author: VeniceCiao
Reviews.Content: On one floor of a palazzo, hidden in a tiny courtyard. You get a set of keys and let yourself in and out. Our room was looking over side canal, but you still get gondolas and working boats going by. Heating was good! Shades of former glory - terrazzo floor, high ceiling, chandelier. Breakfasts nice - except the coffee was instant. Handy for Rialto. If you come over from airport on Allilaguna ferry (13 euros) get off at Fondamente Nove, which saves you having a long hike from San Marco. If you do, make sure they put your luggage in the Fondamente Nove pile.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: December2009
Reviews.Content: Immaculately clean and comfortable hotel run by kind and helpful owner.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: gratefultraveler02
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely visit to Venice this Christmas and it ideal to stay at Locanda Leon Bianco. We had a lovely view of the Grand Canal, the room was spacious, comfortable and lovely. The highlight was the friendly, accommodating and gracious staff and owners. They were delightful.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT .. perfect location, great price and fantastic host”
Reviews.Author: Hutlea
Reviews.Content: Would highly recommend. This place is old, clean and comfy. Room directly on the grand canal with huge doors onto a balcony. Hoge room and comfy bed. The second night we stayed in a smaller room, which was still big, clean and looked on to a small canal. Great host who was friendly and helpful. Would highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Don't be put off by the outside”
Reviews.Author: WRRGloucestershire
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly hidden away inspite of being so central - look for the number on the door. A warm spacious room in the centre of an unseasonably cold Venice. Unless you want big hotel extras, this has everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect romantic location near Rialto”
Reviews.Author: Annette-Louise21
Reviews.Content: The Leon Bianco is located in an old palazzo in the heart of venice old town, less than 5 minutes walk by foot to the famous Rialto bridge and about 10 min to Piazzale San Marco. It is directly on Canal Grande on the opposite to the Rialto market and with a lot of restaurants and shops in this area. We booked the less expensive room with view to a smaller side canal. It has been very calm, perfectly to relax after seesighting. The room is spacey, with modest but charming antique furniture. The breakfast was conveniently served into the room in the morning. It was basic (coffee, jam, croissant could be of better quality) but okay to start the day with. All in all a very good value for expensive Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Bravissimo”
Reviews.Author: DCmirrorlake
Reviews.Content: Stefano was a delight from the initial pre-trip inquiry through our two night stay. The hotel was very clean and conveniently located. The staff was impeccably helpful; we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Good Location, Very Charming”
Reviews.Author: Gary_Hartland
Reviews.Content: Charming place. Friendly staff (she even offered to meet us at the boat taxi stop ... but finding it on our own is half the fun). It looks like it was recently converted from a residence with the bathrooms having been carved out of the corner of the room. Nice period furnishings. Our room on the side canal was very quite. No TV (I count that as a positive). Breakfast was modest. We had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Place”
Reviews.Author: VeniceWanderers
Reviews.Content: 'A Gem of a Place' was how the Venice Travel Guide described the hotel. It was our first time to Venice, so we wanted something special. We decided to splash out on a hotel on the Grand Canal, the view from the room made up for the noise from the Canal all night long, so if you are a light sleeper be warned, it is very noisy. At 220 euros a night though, it was an expensive view. We paid the extra to stay in one of the 'better' rooms. There was no tea or coffee facilities in the room, breakfast was the usual basic croissant and bread roll, plus glass of orange and tea/coffee. I was convinced we had booked a room with air conditioning, if I did then it turned out to be an electric fan and my partner spotted flea's! Having said all that, the location was great, directions from the hotel perfect so we found it easy. The couple who managed the hotel were very friendly and on our last day we had a very early flight and she came from the mainland to make us a cup of tea. Would we go back to Venice again, definitely! Would we stay in the hotel again? Probably not, we would find a hotel off the Canal and if we went in June again, would double check the airconditioning unit was not a fan!

Reviews.Title: “The Staff make all the difference!”
Reviews.Author: johnnyivan
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 3:30pm - exhausted - and dragged our bags up the beautiful old stone stairs to the reception noting that they'd recently been restored. We'd passed another couple waiting below in the dark entryhall with their luggage - and wondered what it was they were waiting for. A very nice, effervescent lady in exhuberant colourful clothing - later to be known as Leila - offered us the sofa in the reception and rushed down the marble stairs. A minute later she was back up the stairs hauling one of their large cases - which wasn't much smaller than herself. "That's why I advised you to wait for me" she said to them, puffing slightly with a broad smile. This immediately impressed us - particularly as many times in Italy we'd been led, unaided, luggage in tow, up flights and flights of stairs without the slightest possibility of a helping hand from the perfectly groomed staff vigilant not to break a sweat! The other couple were probably on the road since the early hours like ourselves. Inbetween dealing with the other couple Leila stole a moment to thrust a bottle of water into my wife's hand. Then it was our turn to be received. To our further surprise she said "We have three rooms that we can offer you. I'll give you a look and you can tell us which one you like the best." The basement one was recently refurbished and featured three windows letting out onto the Riva S.Apostoli. Remarkable. We could if we wished lie in bed and watch the Gondolas slide by at eye level. The next room - upstairs was less plush but also large with a good bathroom. It overlooked the same canal as the basement did and if you looked out the widow, to the left you could even see the Grand Canal itself. We were already impressed before she showed us the next - with some trepidation referring to it as the "Funny Room". A huge space with a bizarre mural featuring some moorish looking scene with camels! We were once again - to her astonishment - impressed. This room overlooked the rear of the hotel and the small campo. She left us then to ponder our dilemma. Each room was great in different ways - even the 'funny one' ("What - you mean you like it?"). After 20 minutes We went for the 1st floor one overlooking the rio. We ended up having a very nice stay and really feel that we'd return to the hotel on another trip. The breakfasts were monotnonous but it's pretty standard fare in Italy: overly refined croissants, rolls and jams. Italians don't really go in for breakfast anyway. 'When in Rome...' Leila even asked us that evening if "you'd like more hot chocolate in the morning" - we hadn't asked, she just thought to offer extra. The stairs where two steep flights. Other reviewers here have complained about them but if you're of average fitness there's no problem. It's all fun. My only quibble would be the wonky connection in the bedside lamp and the fan which didn't work in the bathroom. These are a minor number of faults based on previous experience and to be fair we forgot to to tell the hotel so they may not even be aware of them. It's amazing the number of faults you find in some places! We enquired on the last day about the Ca' DeMosto next door which was the original Albergo Leon Bianco and if TV presenter/Architect Francesco De Mosto might have bought it back to restore it. It looked from the outside as if an attempt to restore had got underway and then halted. They weren't sure if he now had it again - but that the De Mosto family had sold it way back in the 15th Century. Apparently it was the first palace on the Grand Canal and later a very famous hotel. Our hotel was a part of it during the 19th Century; JMW Turner the painter staying in Room 4 and the Emperor of Austria booked the whole building for himself. Behind the hotel, near Strada Nuova is where the ill-fated Doge Marin Falier had his palace before being executed for treason. The 'Unluckiest Doge'. We were sad to leave and I think if the basement room is anything to go by the rest of the hotel is probably soon to be renovated. Meaning, perhaps that it will become more expensive to stay in. We definitely recommend the Leon Bianco. It proved to us that the quality of the staff is, in a way, everything. Perhaps some day we'll get a front room over the Canale Grande.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly different...”
Reviews.Author: mickums
Reviews.Content: Booked room 4 for 3 nights after reading all the good reviews. Must say the place is somewhat overrated and overpriced for what is on offer. Feels more like staying in someones house - once you manage to find the way in and climb the 50+ concrete steps to the door. You are asked to keep your set of keys on you at all times - in order to get in late at night. The room was large with the view we had paid for but very sparsely furnished and litle in the way of creature comforts. The breakfast brought to the room each morning was a bit mean (only 1 plate and 2 small butters) and predictable (same each day). My wife thought the bed too hard. We paid in cash - 210 Euros each night - as requested which is a bit steep just for a view of the Grand Canal and not much else. On the positive side, the location is good and the place is clean (if very shabby). We were lucky to have three lovely sunny days in November and enjoyed our stay. Its just a pity tourists are overcharged everywhere. One really off-putting experience is to see so many people feeding pigeons in St. Marks square and taking photos of them! Don't people realise pigeons are vermin?

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandMillie
Reviews.Content: Have just got back from 3 nights in Venice staying at the Locanda Leon Bianco. After reading mostly good reviews of this guest house, went ahead and booked and we were not disappointed. The hotel gave good directions from the Ca d'Oro vaporetta stop. Don't be put off by the unpromising entrance - a rather musty stairwell then up some dark steps to a first floor lobby area. The first night we had a room overlooking the small canal which was fine but the next two nights we had a room overlooking the grand canal - well worth the extra euros. I was just going to book the smaller room for the whole stay as it was already slightly over our budget, but I'm just so glad I bit the bullet as it was such an experience. It was so beautiful just sitting watching Venice go by. People always look up at the balcony and wave. Lots to see at any time of the day. We didn't find it noisy as the large ceiling to floor windows shut out the noise and left the room very quiet. The staff were very helpful - especially Leila, who was very friendly and brought us our breakfast every morning. She also took a bottle of bubbly I had brought with us and put it in the freezer for a while and provided some lovely champange flutes. If you want all mod cons, internet access, mini bars, tvs etc, then this won't be for you. However, it's simple, spacious, clean and central and we loved it. Also, you can leave your luggage after you've checked out and pick it up at your convenience. All in all, a great stay and I would really recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Highpoint of our visit to Venice”
Reviews.Author: Leenane
Reviews.Content: This hotel did exactly what it said on the tin. Having already bothered to read the Terms & Conditions for our stay, the 10.30 check-out and preference for cash payment was not going to be a suprise. We had paid the extra for a Grand Canal view so that we could enjoy the breakfast (room-service only !) with all windows open (to take in, as much as possible, the canal traffic sights and sounds). Selecting a Grand Canal view does not disappoint. We also found that the hotel's central location (you could see the Rialto Bridge from the room) meant that many of the key sights were easy to walk to. St Mark's square was a 30 minute stroll. The manager (Stephano) and assistant (Layla) were very helpful and, in the morning, allowed us to leave our cases until the 2.00 check-in. Please note that the hotel is the 1st/2nd Floor of the building. So you have to go up steps on arriving at the building to reach the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: lafarge
Reviews.Content: We didn't think we could afford a room with a view of the Grand Canal in Venice, but found the Locanda Leon Bianco on Trip Advisor, and decided to book it. It was wonderful. We had two rooms, one with a view of the Grand Canal and one that was billed as having no view, which actually had a view of a canal. The thing that really impressed us was the warmth and friendliness of the owner, Leila. She was lovely to our three little girls, and couldn't have been nicer to us in general. For instance, we asked for a bottle opener; she brought us one along with two wine glasses. She put the children's bears in their beds each morning, gave them sweets (the children, not the bears), listened to their earnest prattle, and generally made us feel welcome. You have to keep an eye on very little children with the verandahs directly overlooking the canal, and the dividing walls between rooms are not thick. But we had a lovely time and would recommend it here.

Reviews.Title: “A joy for the eyes, not so good for the ears....”
Reviews.Author: Golfing-Steve
Reviews.Content: Venice in January is a wonderful time to visit. Mists swirl round the courtyards and bridges and even the Piazza is quiet. If you want to tour the Doge's palace or see the Basilica in peace then now is the time to go. Locanda Leon Bianco is very well situated at the foot of the Strada Nova hard by the crumbling palace of the Ca' da Mosto teetering on the bank of the Grand Canal. Good eateries are within a short walk- do check out Il Milion and Fiaschetteria Toscana- and a canal fronting room is a delight to the eyes with Ponte Rialto just down on the left and the halls of fish and vegetable markets on the Rialto immediately opposite. But remember the Grand Canal is Venice's main highway and it is far from quiet. In January with shutters and windows closed the deep buzz of the vaporetto chugging past, the throb of the barges and the higher powered engines of motoscafi and police craft is not too off-putting. But boy, do those guys in the fish market make some noise. Shouting and whistling at one another from around six in the morning. On a hot Summer's night, with the added worry of mosquitoes, the canal facing rooms must be deafening and hot. Otherwise, this is a little gem even if you do have to drag your luggage up two flights of steep stairs to get to it. But the welcome is genuinely warm, breakfast is served in one's room as there is no dining room, and the placed is steeped in history. But it is not somewhere I would contemplate staying in high season and, the next time I decide to stay, I shall certainly be taking my ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Much misunderstood”
Reviews.Author: Pavilions
Reviews.Content: Some of the reviews have treated Leon Bianco as if it was a hotel. It is as the title says a Locanda or lodging house. We have stayed there on a number of occasions because it has a more Venetian feel to it. We don't want a TV or a mini bar. Rooms 2,3 and 4 are the best with wonderful views onto the Grand Canal and the Rialto market opposite.
