It is the market that generates the noise in the early morning with deliveries and rubbbish collection, but either take earplugs or watch it all going on from the window. Breakfast is simple, so if you want more pop over to the market on the tragheto, only 50cents for a true gondola ride, to the market and buy some fruit. It is great value for the position it is in, particularly off season. We have had nothing but a warm welcome from Stefano and anyone working there. Give it a try and enjoy the place for what it is, a simple place with wonderful views from those rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Beware ! Con-job of tourists !”
Reviews.Author: joebre
Reviews.Content: Found it difficult to find a suitable hotel for our dates ! Panicked a little and decided to book Leon Bianco ! Charged 165 euro per night for a Junior Suite, overlooking a very small courtyard. We stayed in Room 9, just inside the front door and beside the reception desk. Not a good choice, as the staff spent 2 hours chattering, between 8.00 & 10.00. Breakfast was served in the room as there was no dining room. Breakfast was typical continential, tea/coffee, orange juice, 2 mini rolls, croissant and melba toast per person. You were only given one small plate to share between 2 people.. Overall, our stay was fine, even if over-priced, until the last morning. We got up, as usual for breakfast at 9.45. We then lay back on the bed as we had a number of hours to pass, prior to our flight time. We got an angry knock on the door at 10.50, advising that latest check-out was 10.30 and that we had 10 minutes to leave the room. My wife packed the bags while I went to pay the bill. The hotel prefers cash, which I paid. The housekeeper inquired if we were involved in the hotel industry as the room had been kept in a spotless condition. She was amazed that my wife had made the bed so perfectly each morning ! We asked if we could leave our bags for a couple of hours and the hotel had no problem ! We returned about 3.00 p.m to be accosted by the housekeeper. She asked what we had done to the sheets ? She showed us a large cofffe stain on the sheet and said that the mattrerssses had been destroyed ! We stated that we did not know anything about what happed and that the room had been left open on our departure. I was put on the phone to Stefano who did not bother to call and see us ! We were never shown the damage to the mattress ! I replied that if we had caused damage to his property, that we were unlikely to leave our bags on the premises. I felt that I had explained the situation satisfactorily and we left. I received an e-mail from Stefano 2 days later which stated that all the other people in the hotel were old and that they would not have caused the damage. He was putting a 300 euro charge on my credit card. The subsequent e-mails from him have been aggressive ! I believe that htis is a con-job as we never caused any damage to hotel property and we were never shown the damaged mattress. The stain on the sheet was very dry. Other travellers take note and beware !

Reviews.Title: “Overall good. Quality greatly depends on the room#”
Reviews.Author: chicagousa1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I (early 30's) stayed here in the second stop of a four stop 18 day europe vac (Vienna, Venice, Bellagio, Munich). This was in April 06. We booked because of recommendations on this site and Fodors.com. We booked directly with the hotel through email. In short if you can get Room #4 (with a balcony on the Grand Canal) then grab it. If not, find another hotel. We stayed in 3 different rooms in a 4 night stay. This was because room#4 was only available the middle two nights. This will allow for a good review because we got the full experience of the hotel. The location is good but not great. You are a 5-10 min walk from Rialto Bridge and a 3 min walk to the Ca'Doro Vaparetto stop. Our first impression of the area and hotel (this was our first time in Venice) was that it was dirty and stunk. We quickly forgot the smell/dirt of the streets as we greatly enjoyed our stay. It was difficult to find the hotel as the entrance is off a small walkway that enters into a dirty courtyard shared between the hotel and apts. We were buzzed in and walked up a dark flight of stairs to small lobby which is basically just a desk. Our first night was in room (#6)150E. This was on the small canal. It was a small, plain, dark room. But bathroom was big and great... very recently refurbished. No tv. Bed was fine. Room was very clean. View of small canal was not impressive. Outside was very loud on small canal. Motor boats go down canal all day/night and a garbage boat was loading starting very early 5amish just about 50 meters from our window. So first night was a dissapointment. Second two days were in room#4 (200E/night). This was a special room and special experience. Especially after the first night. Room has two very small balconies that overlook the grand canal. You can see the Rialto bridge. Only big enough for one person to sit on. We often just hung out in the room and watched venice life go by on the canal. One of our most memorable experiences from the trip. Breakfast is served in the room and is small, just bread, croissant, jam/butter and juice. But the best coffee on our trip. . It's included so take it. Room was clean and comfortable and very big. All rooms had hardwood floors and new bathrooms. Last night was in room#5 150E. This room was also on the side canal next to room#6. #5 was bigger and little better than #6. Closer to the grand canal and not quite as noisy as #6. Service was fine. We didn't ask for much. A good service note..on the way out once my wife commented to the desk on how much she liked the coffee. On check out they had a packet of the coffee for us to take home with us. Careful of the staircase, tends to be very dark and uneven stairs. Have to pay in cash. Management would be well served to clean up the courtyard outside the entrance. It leaves a very bad first impression. If not for the diry courtyard and nosiy room#6 (garbage boat in the early am) then it would be 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Be carefull!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: a 3 days vacation reserved on internet. Conversation and very nice owner with Stephano. We arrived at the Locanda...everithing ok. Great room, good price,a very nice lady at the desk. Two hours later my husband was very sick- stomack problems. The nice lady called the ambulance (surprise! no doctor speaking english - at the hospital finally we found one doctor, but only one). Next day..everything ok. Breakfast in the room...very nice ideea, but not a very special breakfast (croissant, butter, coffe, marmelade). Grand Canal view...clean room , i was thinking "that's the better hotel in Venice". Last day:HERE COME'S THE SURPRISES! Excepting the first day when we arrived at the desk hotel was another woman (a older one - she was also the cleaning woman). In the last day at 11.00 just before checking out my husband has another problem with the stomac (be carefull with food in venice...is not very good - especially the tomato sauce) and i go ask the woman if she can give me some boilled water because i want to make a tea. She tells me...no water, no boiled water...no such service after the breakfast. I asked her..but the kitchen is open, is near us, here, why can't you give me some boilled water? I just want to make a tea. She start to scream at me - she made me impolite and when i asked "and if a person is sick your hotel doesn't give him or her a cup of boilled water?" She start to scream again and finally, before calling on the phone Stephano), when i told her to stop screaming at me she told me that she is in her country and i'm just a tourist and she makes what she wants in her country.... After that she called Stephano and she told him a lot of lies (she didn't know that i understand perfect italian). Finally i talk with stephano (he doesn't speak very well english) but my only wish was to leave his hotel. Finally, for all of you...500 eur (3 nights) with great vieu wnd a very good treatment - you can't drink a tea (even if you have the tea and you need just the water). I'm sorry for Stephano, he was a very nice person, i'm sorry for the lady that called the ambulance the first night...but because of one person the lady that i told you...i don't recommend you at all Locanda Al Leon Bianco. I woner...if she was there the first night when we need the ambulance...no other comments
